item.description:
Take a 3-5 mile hike up and around Borderland State Park, a country estate once owned by Blanche Ames, a suffragist and her husband Oakes, a botanist. Wear decent shoes for a wide choice of trails. Bring a daypack with food, water, raingear, a sweater, a hat and gloves and any other hiking gear you might need. The excursion can end with a tour of the Ames Mansion in the early afternoon.

Trip's Leader - Stuart Green, 781-812-6581

MEET: the Visitors Center (with the bathrooms attached), at 259 Massapoag Avenue, at the end of the large parking lot, just a few feet into North Easton. The park is located on the Easton/Sharon line.

RSVP: If you want to RSVP, call TC Stuart Green at 781-812-6581. You can also just show. Rain or a very early snow won’t cancel. 
COST: There is a small charge for parking. There also is a $3 chargee for an optional tour of the mansion once lived in by the Ameses, featuring many of Blanche Ames’ paintings, and furnishings similar to those that filled the rooms when the mansion was used as a residence and $5 guest fee which can be credited to a full Mosaic membership of $25

FOR THE CURIOUS: Check out the park at http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/borderland/.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the Visitors Center (with the bathrooms attached) and contact Stu for more details

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: Explore Borderland State Park and Mansion
